pageContext.claim: “I said, 'I'll tell you, and I'm being serious about it. I want it to be called the Tax Cut, Cut, Cut, Cut Plan. Four cuts.' And we all agreed that was a little bit hokey, so we decided not to do that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a great example of pointless revisionism. It's not clear that Trump ever thought the "Cut, Cut, Cut, Cut" moniker was hokey or dispensable. According to The Washington Post's Josh Dawsey: "Trump did not like the name of the tax bill — one of his biggest hang-ups. He wanted to call it the 'Cut, Cut, Cut Act,' according to advisers and Hill aides. The president did not get his way, and lawmakers settled on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. Trump continues to prefer the 'Cut, Cut, Cut Act,' advisers said."
